properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 7 at 4:22AM AKST until February 9 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Travel will be
very difficult to impossible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to
10 inches, with localized amounts up to 17 inches, are
possible.

* WHERE...Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys.

* WHEN...From Saturday morning through Sunday morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 30 mph will
cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Cold wind chills as
low as 45 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10
minutes to exposed skin.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant
snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue
to monitor the latest forecasts.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
